main event: An unidentified flying object was observed SE of Newfoundland on March 26, 1958, with a slightly ragged, white smoke trail.
interesting points: The observation was made visually and via radar,The sighting lasted approximately 1-3 minutes,The object was concluded to likely be a balloon,Description of the sighting included characteristics typical of a fireball or bolide,The situation was documented without accompanying photographs.
sighted object: unidentified flying object with a smoke trail
witness description: Pilots and crew on an American ship
